head.title: Rejoinder on Ross School: Don't Expect an Apology

hedline.hl1: Rejoinder on Ross School: Don't Expect an Apology

abstract.p: Long Island Pine Barrens Society member Richard Amper letter on Desmond Ryan's July 2 letter offers no apology for cartoon and radio satire about plan to expand Ross School (S)

block.p: It was instructional to read that the big developers' group -- we call it the Association to Blacktop Long Island -- has brought its campaign as far as East Hampton.

Desmond Ryan's letter [''Anti-Ross School Cartoon Picked the Wrong Target,'' July 2] on the opposition by the Pine Barrens Society and by me to the 50-building, 484,000-square-foot expansion of the Ross School entirely misses the point.
It was instructional to read that the big developers' group -- we call it the Association to Blacktop Long Island -- has brought its campaign as far as East Hampton.

Desmond Ryan's letter [''Anti-Ross School Cartoon Picked the Wrong Target,'' July 2] on the opposition by the Pine Barrens Society and by me to the 50-building, 484,000-square-foot expansion of the Ross School entirely misses the point.

Our cartoon and radio satire focuses not on children but on the so-called grown-ups who have declared that they are bulldozing the Pine Barrens in a state-designated Special Groundwater Protection Area to teach children environmental appreciation (in the words of their environmental impact statement).

We have not apologized for our reaction to this preposterous premise or to the biggest development ever proposed on the South Fork. It is the Ross School and the development-at-any-cost crowd that should apologize.
RICHARD AMPER Long Island Pine Barrens Society Manorville
